review_text: I loved that it was close to a lot of restaurants. There was lots to do in the area but if you’re not a walker I recommend using the bird or lime scooters. It’s WWAAAAAYYYYY cheaper than getting an Uber. The place was great but if you do like a dark setting in the morning it’s probably not it. The windows are huge with white blinds. I personally loved the windows but not the bright natural light in the mornings especially having some drinks or staying up late that pervious night. Overall my best friend and I had a great time and will do it all over again.

We loved the location, and of course the cool Seattle air! We were a close walk to most everything. In unit washer/dryer was great to have so we could return home with clean clothes in our luggage. Lots of books to read.
We enjoyed the guest journal of things to do and see! Very helpful. We love to sleep with the windows slightly ajar. We had plenty of blankets to stay warm while slept. The late night sounds (sirens, garbage trucks, and early morning seagulls) were only slightly distracting. We could have opted to keep the windows closed, but liked them slightly open while sleeping, better.

Everything else about the location was great!

The location is great! Not too far from everything, great restaurants within a <5 minute walk, and relatively easy to find! Phuong was very communicative.
I will say though, maybe we were at a bad angle or we're just too short, but we could only see the very top of the space needle, unlike the pictures we saw showed. The alleyway to enter/exit the garage is very suspicious with people loitering in there pretty frequently.
The space is very cozy and they have almost all the streaming apps! We're not firm bed people, so the bed wasn't our favorite.
Overall, the walkablility of the location and the free parking are the best parts! Not sure it's worth our money, but not everything can be everyone's cup of tea. :)

Phuong takes such amazing care of this rental and we could immediately see that they take pride in being quick to return any communication or questions. We kicked off a week and a half road trip by staying here and watching a couple baseball games. Knowing how big Seattle was, and having driven our own car (a Honda Civic), the extremely secure in-building parking and entry/exit of the building itself alleviated any concerns I might have had about driving my personal vehicle. You absolutely can't beat the price when it comes to this amazing location paired with the previously mentioned parking arrangement. Ridiculously close to everything along the water, the Seattle Center, and so many other things I can't even list them all; walking distance is an understatement! My wife and I absolutely recommend this spot and will with a doubt be staying here again next summer. Thank you for helping us kick off our road trip on such an amazingly bright note. See you again soon!! - Loryl and Mary -

This apartment was perfect for our short stay in Seattle. It was walking distance from both Pike Place market as well as the Space Needle. There are tons of restaurants and things to do in the area. The building itself is very secure and is super neat! We loved seeing the historical pictures on the wall of the lobby. The apartment itself is very small but the space works really well for two people. The only issue we had was that there was no air conditioning and it happened to be extremely hot in Seattle when we were there. There were fans and windows, but we were still hotter than we would have liked.
Phuong was also extremely communicative and provided quick responses and recommendations for the area. We had no issues getting in the building or parking, and you can tell she really put a lot of thought into decorating and making the apartment nice for guests.

We didnt have an issue with figuring out to eat, we just walked up and down the street and was able to pick and choose whatever we were craving for at the moment!
Thank you again for having us!

Rating, 4 stars

January 2022

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Phuong texted us in advance lots of good instructions for getting to the space, parking and entering. It seems like a lot, but/and all very very useful and appreciated.
The location is perfect. The space is comfortable enough to chill inside, tho it’s location again is perfect, so you’re going to want to walk just a few blocks to get food, see sights and just immerse yourself in downtown Seattle.
I let Phuong know the unit could use a deep deep cleaning. It could also use some upgrades like nice glasses/dishes and a few more, current magazines, but the price and location and communication were all spot on, so we agree we would stay here again.
Highly recommend Roquette for good (also expensive) drinks really close and just south of the front entrance of the apartment, Limoncello for delicious pizza and salad and Bangrok Market for absolutely amazing Thai just a few blocks away.
Phuong’s place is just a short walk to Pike’s Place” (about two blocks away) and also the space needle.

Lots of restaurants nearby if you didn't want to cook.

The ONLY problem we had was a heavy-footed and constantly moving upstairs neighbor. It's not anything that the host would have been able to do anything about and it might have just been for the nights we were there, but I wanted to include it in my review in case that would be a deal-breaker for you.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Our two night stay was fine, and about as expected. The building is centrally located in downtown, just a few blocks from Pike Place Market. It's easy to get in and out as needed. The space definitely seemed smaller than the pictures, which clearly show the best possible version of the rooms. We didn't have an issue accommodating to the place. This is essentially a hotel suite with the bedroom separate, more than a vacation home. The beds were decent, but not great, and the small kitchen was only stocked with the bare minimum. You wouldn't want to go there expecting to really cook anything. There were no ice trays in the freezer, for example. The bathroom had a picture hanging on a stained wall that said "So Fresh and So Clean" which was certainly ironic. The lack of parking also adds to the overall expense of the stay, so definitely something to keep in mind. Ours was $90 in a secure lot from Friday afternoon until Sunday morning.

Our biggest challenge was the key code the next morning. There were four of us staying at Mine. Three of us left to go get coffee, and when we returned the key code did not work on the outside door or apartment door. We had to call the 4th person staying with us to come down and let us in. And the 4th person had to leave something in the apartment door so not to be locked out of the apartment.
We contacted Mine through Airbnb and did not receive a response until after we had checked out.

The Oxford is in its own right, just as fancy and feels like home. I will always return here whenever I come back to my home state of Seattle :)

review_text:
The location was amazing! Perfect for travelers who dont want to spend money on renting a car and are looking to just explore seattle on a short trip.
Location was GREAT.
Short walk from the Light Rail (caught from the airport) and an even shorter walk from Pikes!
So many great restaurants, coffee shops, shops, and sights to see! Great location for all forms of public transportation. Which are all safe and CHEAP. Even caught the Rail to a Mariners game and space needle.
The staff was very kind. The Man at the front was a sweetheart! Always checking in on us as we came and went. Asking if we needed anything. We got there earlier than check out but he kindly offered to hold our bags in a safe spot so we could explore while waiting.
Honestly, Im going back. Theres so much more I want to explore in seattle and At Mine is a MUST STAY. Well priced, great location, kind staff, and SAFE AREA.
Grateful for this place. I will recommend to anyone headed to Seattle City.

Texting and ensuring we had everything we needed and was incredibly gracious with a late check out to accommodate our symphony tickets. I loved being able to go and grab coffee and then enjoy the morning with my daughter in the space. Quiet, secure, a very friendly and attentive front desk as well. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Thank you At Mine rentals!
I stayed in one of At Mine's updated and stylish 1-BR apartments in the Oxford building, an attractive 1920s(?) era building located at the southern edge of Belltown neighborhood in downtown Seattle. A very appealing neighborhood to stay in: fun stuff in all directions, and close to three rail lines plus buses. The location and amenities made it the perfect spot for my visit, and the price was very competitive (cheaper than other options without sacrificing quality).
The rental is as advertised--it looks like the pictures. Large and somewhat luxurious bathroom with full size bathtub; high quality towels and bedding; spacious kitchen; high ceilings.
Staff was responsive and helpful. They stored my luggage the whole day after my checkout, which allowed me to explore the city more freely on my last day in town.
My verdict: visit Seattle, and stay with At Mine rentals. I highly recommend.

Stayed one night
review_text: Amazing value for the price! I booked here last minute because I needed a place to stay in downtown Seattle for a spontaneous trip. I picked it because it was the most affordable, so I was very surprised to enter the property and be met with such high quality. Upon arriving, I had to enter a code to access both the building and the unit, which made me feel safe. There is a vending machine with snacks in the lobby! They provided us with very clear instructions on how to access our unit and we had no problems at all getting in quickly and safely. The unit was very clean and much more spacious than I expected, it had a fully stocked kitchen with lots of coffee ingredients and everything you could need! There is a TV and nice seating and lights in the living room. Even a table to eat or relax at. The bedroom was cozy and the bathroom was fully stocked with many soaps/lotions/towels/etc. I truly have no complaints. Staff were extremely quick to respond and very sweet and helpful!

review_text: I just needed a last-minute place to stay for one night, for a reasonable price. I booked this place based on the price and reviews. I was happily surprised that was not only a beautiful, clean and well-stocked apartment, but that it was one block away from Pike Place! I absolutely loved the area! And the host was very proactive about providing us with accurate information and parking recommendations. One small thing, is that Sunday night/Monday morning must’ve been garbage day, so in the middle of the night we were awaken by the loud trucks. If you plan on staying Sunday-Monday, just be sure to bring earplugs or use the provided white-noise machine. But even with that small issue, I will definitely be back!

name: Jessica
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Look no further for your Seattle getaway – this place is an absolute gem! If you're visiting Pike Place Market or catching a game, you couldn't ask for a better location. Situated just blocks away from the bustling market but despite its proximity to the lively streets, the unit tucked away at the back of the building offers a serene retreat, ensuring a peaceful stay. The space is not only beautifully decorated but also incredibly spacious – a rarity in this vibrant neighborhood. Perfect for a couple or small family.
While the updated kitchen boasts all the amenities for whipping up a meal, with so many fantastic restaurants nearby, you'll likely find yourself in Seattle's culinary delights. Check-in was a breeze, thanks to the attentive host who's always just a message away, they're readily available either in person or through Airbnb. The building's elevator is a perk, plus, the street-accessible stairway adds an extra layer of convenience.
I can't recommend this place enough!

review_text: Gorgeous area I never knew existed . So peaceful and tranquil. Super sweet hosts and very quiet place for good rest. However if you plan on going into the city I wouldn’t recommend this area to somebody without a car. It costs about $13 to take an Uber to the Angle light rail station ($20+ to go to the SeaTac light rail stop) and then it’s quite a long commute into the city - for me it was almost an hour. I had read other reviews that made the city sound more accessible, again if you don’t have a car this isn’t the case.

Paul and his wife were great host! The communication was great & very friendly! I appreciate Paul's wife introducing herself and asking how are stay was!
Location : The location is pushed back area with beautiful views and the water. Took about 20-30 minutes to Seattle depending on traffic & close to restaurants and other parks!
Parking: was nice to be in the drive way on the gravel! Appreciate my car not having to be in the street!
Inside : Their home is beautiful, clean, & quiet. You have a room/bathroom/ living space to choose from, along with a nice porch to enjoy your coffee on!
Bed was nice, fans provided, & lots of blankets! (love to feel cozy)
Thanks again for the lovely stay, would recommend for short stay!

·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Paul’s place was great for our needs (flying into SEA-TAC and then exploring seattle for a day before heading on a national parks road trip). The space was clean and private, and the area is right around Puget Sound, making it very peaceful and great for a hike! The view of Mt Rainier from the property is not necessarily what is shown in photos but a quick drive down to the Marine View Park provides a stunning view of Mt Rainier and Puget Sound, and the sunset/sunrise from the room is beautiful. Getting into the property was easy and water was left in our room in addition to some drinks and granola bars. My one suggestion for Paul is to please provide a water cooler or area for people to fill up their water bottles before leaving for the day in the same area as the coffee/dining room. Not having this was a bit stressful. Thanks! Would definitely stay here again

review_text: Very nice stay, especially for the price. I did have some issues with check-in (AirBNB error did not send me the access code) but Paul was very responsive and extremely sweet and helpful by coming out to greet me, teaching me how to use the access code pad, and up to the room. The room is upstairs close to the private bathroom which were both large and clean. He said I could use the refrigerator but when I came back from dinner someone was in there with the door closed and didn’t want to disturb them so I did not use it. The back deck is very nice and quiet but there is no real view of the bay or mountains like the pictures show. The neighborhood is beautiful, quiet, safe, and nice to walk around although it is very hilly. His front garden is beautiful with many kinds of flowers.

Beautiful surroundings, beautiful views, nice and private. The location worked perfectly for my plans. The bedroom was clean & comfortable and the private bathroom was roomy with a bath area and a dressing area with a sink in each area. The host also provide a nice living room and dining room for relaxing and eating.
The only drawbacks were there was no television in the bedroom and the Wi-Fi was not strong enough to stream a movie and scroll the internet at the same time. Despite that, if I need overnight accommodations in the Seattle area, I will be looking up this place again. I felt really comfortable and safe, without all the hotel/motel hassles. Thank-you for a wonderful, restful, place to spend the night.

Perfectly charming apartment in a beautiful and incredibly walk-able neighborhood. The apartment is adorable and well appointed with a nice kitchen and lots of extra towels and warm blankets. The view from the little window facing downtown might as well be a picture out of a travel brochure. Pretty much everything you need is a short walk away. Top-tier coffee shop is just across the street. Trader Joe's is a short walk as well as fun pub food or fine dining.
David is proactive with communication and made sure our arrival was a breeze. There is a very thorough binder with explanations of all the house's systems and amenities like internet and laundry as well as local menus and food suggestions. Really a top-notch host. We had a great time.

My mom absolutely loved the accommodation and enjoyed every moment of her stay. I can’t recommend David’s place enough - it’s the perfect location if you are visiting Seattle. Nestled in the heart of Queen Anne, within walking distance of all the local shops, restaurants and the beautiful Kerry park vantage point, with its views of the Seattle skyline and Mt Rainier beyond. It’s central location in the city also allows you to get to all of the other wonderful neighborhoods relatively quickly. Will definitely book with David again in the future!

We had a peaceful three-night stay at David’s loft apartment. He has thought of everything to make for a great visit to Seattle. The Space needle is visible from the bedroom window. His suggestion to use the electric bikes and Lyft to get around will help you to manage the steep hills in parts of Seattle. There are also busses and trolleys spanning the city.
There is a cute cupcake shop and an ice cream shop right at the street corner as well as other cafes and restaurants.
We had a great time and recommend David’s place when you stay in Seattle!

review_text: My brother and I had a great stay at David's apartment in Queen Anne. The upstairs loft sleeping area was so peaceful and had a great view of the Space Needle. The apartment had everything we needed and more - David went out of his way to provide snacks, wine, lots of clean towels and great instructions for everything. Communicating with David was excellent - he was so responsive, friendly and helpful. The apartment is around the corner from an excellent coffee shop, a couple blocks from an awesome viewing area for downtown Seattle and the bay, and directly up the Queen Anne hill (oh boy, is Seattle hilly!) from a bunch of restaurants, bars, shops and transportation. It was easy to go south or north from our perch near the top of Queen Anne. I would recommend David's place to friends and would stay there again the next time I'm visiting Seattle.

The only caveat at all that I should note is that there are two sets of stairs that one must negotiate to get to the apartment, and there is in additional set of stairs inside the apartment to get to the bedroom. These stairs are not rickety or unusually steep, but they might be a concern if you have trouble with stairs. But overall, the place is quite comfortable and quiet.

review_text: This apartment was a fantastic location for first-time visitors to the Seattle area. The apartment is in a very safe neighborhood, just blocks away from Kerry Park - the best view of the city skyline. Super convenient to walk to local coffee spots, restaurants, and shopping in the very nice Queen Anne neighborhood. This apartment is less than a mile walking to the main Seattle Center where you can visit the Space Needle, MOPOP, and Chihuly Glass Museum. The apartment itself was clean and comfortable, the perfect size getaway for two - with even a view of the Space Needle from the loft. The host was easily accessible both before and during our stay to answer any questions we had. We would definitely stay here again!

review_text: The location of David’s apartment is fantastic. Everything on the top of Queen Anne is walkable and really everywhere in Seattle if you love to walk. Queen Anne is my favorite neighborhood of Seattle. The only issue was they are building condo’s across the street and the workers started at 7a to 5 or 6pm. Street parking is tight but David had a parking pass for us. At times we had to park a block or two away which is common in Queen Anne and no big deal. I feel we should have been advised of the construction/parking prior to our booking but it really wasn’t bad and we were out most of the time. Fantastic weather and a gorgeous city view off of Highland drive, 2 blocks away from the apartment. We’d come back.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: David's place is a cozy, two-level spot in the Queen Anne neighborhood. It's easily walkable to several coffee shops, bakeries and restaurants. The unit does have multiple stairs so that could definitely be an issue for some. The bed was super comfortable, the shower pressure was excellent and the place was clean. If you're looking for a modern, chic apartment, this isn't it; however, if you're looking for a comfortable, clean place to stay with all amenities and a friendly host, this is it. The tub was excellent! The bed was super comfortable. As a few reviewers mentioned, there is construction going on across the street and it starts at 6:45 am. The portable A/C unit cools off the upstairs but also blocks most of the noise. This was a good place to stay for value, convenience and rest. Thanks, Dave!

The apartment was spacious and really clean in an adorable neighborhood. It's just minutes from a little park with stunning views of downtown, and it's close enough to walk to the Space Needle/Seattle Center (about 20-25 minutes). The only thing that could be improved was the mattress (a bit lumpy) but nothing else aside from that. I would stay here again!

review_text: Lovely private apt in the beautiful Queen Anne neighborhood. David was communicative and self check-in was easy, especially since we had a late flight arrival. Apt was clean and provided the essentials and greeted with a bottle of red wine and snacks. We didn't have a car and relied on Ubers, Lime bikes, and our legs. David provides a parking permit pass if you have a car. Laundry is in a separate room outside the apt. Neighborhood is full of beautiful houses, a stone's throw to Kerry Park with skyline views, and walkable to great cafes (Koda, Moonrise, Fiore), ice cream , and grocery/drug stores. Not in our host's control, but there is construction of a new condo across the street and we heard light construction (like stones repeatedly dropped in a dumpster) most mornings by 6 am or a bit before -- we were from East Coast, so were awake by then and not too bothered. We would stay if we visited again.

David's place can't be beat if you are looking to stay in Seattle. Easy check in with a keypad, convenient parking, and snacks and wine were waiting for us on arrival which was a nice treat. David and John were friendly and communication was quick and easy.
There is a cozy coffee shop just a two minute walk away and even more great places within a five minute walk.
The neighborhood is quiet and friendly and I don't think we went outside once without someone saying hello.
The bed and shower were top notch and you have a view of the Space Needle right out the bedroom window.
We came to seattle in part to enjoy the fall foliage and we spent our mornings on the patio drinking our coffee and tea with a front row seat to those fall colors.
This was a wonderful place to stay and I can't say a single bad thing about it. This will be our home base again the next time we visit Seattle.

review_text: I stayed at David's place for two months and it was a great stay. He was incredibly response to all my questions and helped quickly whenever I needed it. The location is incredibly convenient to neighborhood amenities and has easy access to the downtown area, as well as Ballard, Fremont, and Green Lake. The deck is beautiful and smells like waffle cones from Molly Moon's ice cream. The sheets and towels are soft and the bed is very comfortable—not too soft, but not too firm either. As the pictures show, there's a lot of decor and household amenities (like cookbooks) in the space. I felt like I was staying in someone's home, rather than a guest space. That was cozy, but also meant more to clean and because some pieces of decor were broken when I arrived, I was extra nervous about anything potentially fragile. Overall, it was a wonderful place to stay.

review_text: Wonderful location on top of Queen Anne hill, just a couple blocks from Kerry Park and an amazing view of the city. The place was beautiful and clean. The bed was very comfortable. David was responsive and pleasant when I met him in person. There is tons of natural light and space. There is plenty of parking which is not always the case in seattle. The washer and dryer are not in the unit but just a short set of stairs around the corner in there own space. Stairs are not an issue for me but there are many stairs to get up to the unit and stairs in the unit. Something to keep in mind if you have mobility issues. Would highly recommend and had a lovely stay.

I spent a few weeks here in January and walking the 3 blocks to Kerry park, overlooking downtown and the Sound as the skies cleared after days of rain was amazing. Pizza at Via Tribunali is excellent and a 100 feet or so away. The central shopping and dining district is walking distance. And easy bus routes to downtown. Definitely recommend

review_text: This air bnb is in a nice, quiet, & safe area. Kerry Park is down the street & a nice place to get a good view of the water/space needle. Walkable to a few coffee shops/restaurants & right down the street from the bus stop. You get the entire floor to yourself with a private entrance, but there are stairs that lead up to the host's area that can cause noise to travel between the floors. We weren't too bothered by their noise & they respected their noise level in the morning & in the evenings. The bed and pillows are so comfortable! If you're worried about privacy, you're fine. The hosts never came down, not even to retrieve their packages I left for them on the stair landing. If we were to visit Seattle again, we would come back.

I don't know where to start this review. Everything was very good.
Ralph is one of the best hosts I've ever met. He makes sure everything is very clear to you, he answers all your questions and is incredibly kind. You won't really regret staying here.
The location is very good! Close to Kerry park with an amazing view of Seattle and very close to bus stops to downtown. The neighborhood is very quiet. I walked with my husband around 1 am and found it safe to us.
We stayed 3 days and had everything needed to be very comfortable. Autumn just started and we were put a heater in the room, it definitely helped a lot to sleep. It also has a fan and air for the hot days.
It's completely private, we go in and out on our own. We were able to park at the door.
We would definitely stay here again every time we visit Seattle.

The stay was as pleasant as the host. Ralph's place is a beautiful well-kept house in a quiet neighborhood. There are plenty of eateries and stores just around the corner and the neighborhood is very walkable and clean. It is quite accessible by public transit as the bus is only a few minutes away. The western-themed bedroom and bathroom was a nice touch, with amenities appropriate for a short stay.
Kerry Park, which is only a couple of blocks away, offers great views of the city. The hilly streets are conducive to exercise on vacation. And to top it all off, a friendly neighborhood cat lives down the street and likes to greet pedestrians.

Other than that I slept like a baby on the comfortable bed. The location is an absolute gem with an amazing view of Seattle from Kerry Park less than a 5 mins walk away. Seattle Centre is a short walk down the hill. Having the ability to park and leave the car for a few days was nice. I walked everywhere which was great on the way down but remember that you have to come back via a steep uphill incline. Wear comfy shoes. I had a wonderful stay at Ralph’s and I would definitely stay here again.

We had to walk several blocks on very hilly streets with icy sidewalks to get to a bus stop. Even with a car, several of the streets were still blocked or very slick (we saw several cars backing down hills).

name: Annette
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
November 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Ralph’s AirBnB is a spacious room at one end of a hallway, with a bathroom at the other end. It was private for us, because Ralph was gone during our stay. Otherwise, it does feel like you’re living in someone else’s house, and someone might walk down the stairs at any moment. (You might want to bring a bathrobe for the ‘trek’ down the hall to the bathroom). That said, for us, it felt like we had an entire apartment for ourselves, rather than just a room. It had everything you need for a comfortable stay, minus a full kitchen. We had breakfast ‘in’ one morning, and it worked out fine in the room.
The neighborhood is quiet, with good amenities within walking distance. That said, there is currently construction under way for a new apartment building across the street, which the room overlooks. Work starts at 7:30 am and ends at 5 pm. If you stay over the weekend, you won’t have a problem, but during the day on a weekday, it is very noisy. At night, though, it is quiet, and we slept well in a comfy bed.
Check in was very easy, and Ralph is very responsive. All in all, this is a good choice for the price. I would recommend staying here, with a word of caution about the construction.

name: Chris
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
October 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The description of the arrangement as a "COVID safe private apartment sealed off from 2 upstairs floors" is not accurate. The stairways up and down from the "private" area are not sealed by anything except some symbolic obstacles. I could clearly hear everything going on in what I assume was the kitchen at the top of the stairs, and on occasion smell what the hosts were cooking.
Also, at least 3 times during my stay, the hosts had to enter the "private" floor to gather something from another room, and the two times when I was there to see it, they weren't wearing masks. So if you're sensitive about COVID risk and don't want to be in a space where strangers are breathing, this is not the listing for you.
However, everything else about my stay was absolutely delightful. I've rarely found an Airbnb so well appointed and thoughtfully furnished. The room was nicer than my own bedroom at home, and I was completely comfortable there. The location was easy to get to and near great restaurants and a park with amazing views of the city. An easy 5 stars if it weren't for the misleading listing text.

review_text: My husband & I had such a wonderful time staying at Ralph’s apartment on Queen Anne Hill. Ralph & his wife are both so kind and Ralph was highly responsive! His apartment was clean, comfortable and best of all - close proximity to so much! My favorite being Kerry Park. My husband and I walked to Kerry Park every morning and every night during our stay to start & end our days and it was just the loveliest cherry on top of our first trip to Seattle! We couldn’t have done that had we not been staying just a couple of streets over! There’s also a really great pizza place- Via Tribunali, Donut place-Top Pot Donuts (seriously yummy!!) and coffee shop-Caffe Fiore literally right next door!! Oh can’t forget the ice cream and cupcakes for my sweets lovers! We didn’t get to try the cupcakes but I’m sure they’re just as great as the ice cream from Molly Moon’s! Besides having all of these great places nearby, Ralph’s place has all the amenities you could need for your trip. Bonus- A parking spot in a place that is extremely difficult to find parking (if you’re renting or driving in). Lastly- the price- this is what first grabbed my attention and ultimately made me decide on it. But the comfy bed and the cozy space and nearby experiences & grubs is what’s got me so happy I decided to book Ralph’s! Thanks Ralph for sharing your gem of a spot within Seattle with us!

Rating, 5 stars

August 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
In all possible ways, staying at Ralph’s Airbnb was an amazing decision for us.
LOCATION:
- convenient located near a bus stop!
- 5-10 minute walk from Trader Joe’s
ROOM:
- decor is old western, very cute!
- 2 of everything for each person: tables, chairs, bedside stamp with a lamp & outlet.
- AC is 10/10 during hot summer days
- overlooks the street, but trees provide privacy.
BATHROOM:
- very clean and plush bath mats
- separate from room, will have to walk down a hallway
- shower temperature range is good
A word of advice for those considering staying here:
- located in Queen Anne, for those unfamiliar, you’ll be trekking up multiple hills and workout those calves if you place too much trust in google maps. Take the bus, or the long way around.
- as it’s located in a quiet neighborhood, it’s great for 2 friends or a solo traveler, but if traveling in a louder/ larger group, you may want to consider another area.
Ralph and his wife are both incredibly kind and provide amazing recommendations if it’s your first time in the area. I hope you enjoy your time in Seattle just as much as I did!

Traveling on my own, it's nice to know you are in a safe neighborhood even when arriving back late and knowing someone else is around in the home but also having my own space. Everything was super clean, fresh smelling and cheery, and I was glad to be able to wash my clothes mid-trip like I was in my own home. It was very nice to be able to park a car in their driveway too. Ralph was very available to answer any questions and as a nice bonus even installed a new AC unit during the heatwave (most homes in the area don't have AC because of the temperate climate). I'll definitely book again if I'm back in that area.

review_text: Great place to stay for good times in Seattle. Just enough amenities to provide all you need. Location is at the top of a big hill so just down the street is Kerry Park with one of the most amazing views of downtown Seattle you'll find (and free!). Suggest looking up bus times for the Queen Anne hill so you don't have to trek up the whole way if you've enjoyed downtown a lot and are tired. Still, a bit further along Queen Anne are some great places for food, cafe-sitting, and shopping so you don't even have to go down the hill if you don't feel like it. Great place and lovely people hosting it.

If you're visiting the Seattle Center and you don't want to walk up the hill back to the airBnb, just hop onto the #2 or #13 bus!

Rating, 4 stars

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
GREAT LOCATION! If location is the main thing to you then this place is WONDERFUL!
CHECK IN: A bit confusing. Not only could we not get host to answer our concerns about getting in late, we also couldn't figure out where to park once we got there. The #1 spot had a number, but it was not visible in the dark. Headlights didn't shine high enough to see it and it was the same color as the wood. Took about 15 minutes to find the #1 and get parked. Then we had to figure out the two key boxes. We did get in... obviously, but it wasn't what I would call smooth.
NOT SUPER COMFORTABLE: The rule of "no shoes" was very understandable with sand from the beach being everywhere. However, the floors were all hard. Even the Living room rug was not soft to the feet. We were a family of 4 and there were really only two places to sit comfortably. Nice looking place, but not what I'd call cozy at all.
AMENITIES: Lots of them! Free samples everywhere were a very nice touch!
GREAT SHOWER
BEAUTIFUL VIEW

He is absolutely the best of the best....you will always be in excellent hands with his guidance. We spent Thanksgiving celebrating in this wonderful beachside condominium on the beach! Shhhhhhh, please don't share this jewel!! We want to keep it to ourselves!

This was a fantastic stay! We booked from a Monday through Friday and everything was accurately described and had even more than expected. All the little amenities we needed were there and then some.
I slept better on the bed than I do in my own. I was pleasantly surprised to get to use a weighted blanket and will probably end up getting one for myself!
We tried 4 of the restaurants on the beach within 5-6 minute walk for each. Great food and very friendly staff everywhere we went.
It was a short drive into Seattle, Easy to get to, but we did uber there to avoid parking.
If you like people watching, this is the perfect place. Sitting on the balcony and relaxing watching the beach was fantastic. It can get a little busy, especially since weather was nice, but traffic pretty much stopped after dark.
Overall fantastic experience, I would definitely book again!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Look no further, stop your search, and just book here. This is, hands down, one of the best Airbnb's I've stayed in. The linens are very soft, bed is like an oversized pillow, kitchen fully stocked, nice sized tv, and most of all ... a balcony a stone's throw from water and 5hr sunsets. What else could you want? Oh, there are dozens of restaurants and things to do within a 5min walk. My girlfriend and I relaxed in the patio for hours watching the beach and passersby. The only thing is can get loud during busy/summer times, and you can hear the cars (esp the hot rods) when they go by. But locally they've imposed curfews now and by 12-1am or so on most nights it's a ghost town and you can quite literally hear the ocean from the couch inside. This isn't a "get away from the world" spot until it's really late, but it's definitely a happening, clean, fun, centrally located and sunset filled spot. Michael was awesome as well. Just book!

Michael was very responsive and attentive to details, he checked in a couple times to make sure I was enjoying the stay. The place was easy to check in, very clean and had all the essentials such as shampoo, body wash, earplugs, deodorant and even some wine and energy drinks. This is rare for Airbnbs so I really appreciated the thoughtfulness put into adding little quality of life items into the rental.
Alki is a great area that feels very neighborhoody and safe to be in, even at night. It's also a short 15-minute drive to Downtown Seattle which is great if you want to do things in the city and come back to a nice peaceful stay.
I have no complaints and would easily stay here again.

review_text:
Michael, What a treat to stay in your place! Low key, we were a bit nervous when we arrived late Friday night when cars across the street were playing loud music. But, once we got inside, we couldn’t hear them at all! 😁 Great windows! With all of the extra care to detail, we could tell that Michael truly cares for his guests. The apartment was very clean & spacious. The ambiance made us feel like we were guests in our own home. We totally appreciated the extra value to the romantic setting at the table with wine, the welcoming bedroom, and the choice beverages in the fridge. I totally loved that this dude provides recycling opportunities for almost anything.
You can’t beat the beach view out the front window!! The balcony was a great place to chill. Loved that a sand beach was directly across the street and lots of great food choices were just steps away! If you wanna do a getaway in WA this is definitely the place!! We don’t feel like we missed anything at all by not staying in a hotel suite downtown!
Thanks a million Michael!

Stayed one night
review_text:
I frequent a LOT of Air BnBs—this one is the best I have visited!
A fully-functioning loft garage apartment with a Murphy bed. Mattress and pillows were amazing. Plenty of blankets and lighting fixtures. A ceiling fan!!!! The kitchen had ALL of the amenities——ALL!!! A recycling bin was provided. TV had actual channels—not the subscription TV you usually get. Marvelous bathroom and lots of windows and light. It’s quiet and secluded and private. The space has been well-designed and furnished with your comfort and relaxation in mind. The owners obviously love their place.
Walk down to the main road and turn left to get to a nice spot of beach. Be advised that these are not sand beaches; nonetheless, the views are great. Not too many amenities within walking distance, but if you have a ride, it’s a short distance to Safeway, restaurants, and the West Seattle water taxi which takes you downtown to Pier 50, which is walkable to the Pike Market.

review_text: We cannot say enough good things about this Airbnb. My fiancé and I have been long distance for 1.5 years, so we’ve been to our fair share of airbnbs. I wanted to use this trip to to celebrate his new job and birthday a few days prior. Firstly, we were greeted by the host upon arrival. He was friendly and pointed out the two entrances we could use to access the backyard. The backward was absolutely charming. I initially booked this listing because of the quaint kitchen thinking it’d be great for a small dinner or breakfast in the morning. Although we didn’t get to use it, it was well stocked with teas, coffee and even microwaveable snacks in the freezer. That’s a first! The neighborhood was beautiful and within walking distance to the beach. It felt safe and had convenient street parking and/or a equally convenient parking spot. One of the best, if not the best Airbnb we’ve booked. TLDR: charming, private, convenient, well stocked, and walking distance to beach.

review_text: This unit is among the top ten AirBnBs I have stayed in. I recommend it to everyone except those who cannot do stairs. The neighborhood is West Seattle, which you need to know; I like West Seattle very much for the orientation to nature, but you aren’t as conveniently located to downtown — just check out a map. The place is around the corner from the host’s house. On the first floor is a washer and dryer, which is a bonus. You then head up to the living area. It looks like real people use it regularly, and it would be a terrific in law suite. There is a full kitchen with equipment. There is a dining nook. The sleeping arrangement is a Murphy bed more on the soft side (but quality, not mushy or old). The hosts were easy to work with. The parking is not difficult.

review_text: We have stayed at Kathy's place several times now, and it continues to be our VERY favorite place to stay. As noted in my prior reviews, the space is creatively optimized and extremely cozy. More importantly (to us), it's QUIET. And yet, you can literally walk out the door, around the block (100 or so steps), and be looking out over the Sound at the Olympic mountains. INCREDIBLE. Everything is clean, well-organized and thought-through, and just where it should be. Oh - and here's an anecdote, to give you an idea of how thoughtful and considerate the hosts are: we stayed the weekend before Thanksgiving, and their turkey was in the freezer in the garage underneath the unit. They called me, and left several messages (I was at a conference, and didn't notice), and waited until I contacted them back, before they came over to enter the garage and retrieve it - just because they didn't want to "intrude" (even though I wasn't even there!). Needless to say, SUPER nice and thoughtful people!!! Can't wait to stay here again. :-)

name: Donald
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2021
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: This was my second stay, a brief one on my way through Seattle and right after I had stayed forseveral days a couple of weeks before. Kathy's place is excellent for a couple or a solo traveler. The place is a converted garage and the design is very well done. A portion of the 1st level provides the entrance as well as the washer/dryer. Older folks might want to know that there is a flight of stairs to get to the main space, which reminded me of being in the trees. Kathy's place is the most well-stocked AirBNB that I have reserved, the kitchen has almost every utensil and cooking pot/pan that one might need for their stay. And the same goes for the bath. There is small patio area of which I didn't take advantage but I assume that it could be used to enjoy the night air. The beach and hike/bike lane is a short walk from the house and West Seattle is a wonderful place that reminded me of Austin TX back in the ninties. (I haven't lived in Austin since the ninties, so I'm not sure whether it is the same or not.) With GPS, the apartment is easy-to-find and having the West Seattle Bridge closing meant a little congestion late in the afternoon in one spot, but overall I enjoyed exploring the streets of West Seattle. There are tons of restarants, grocery stores and exercise opportunities, as well as a great view of downtown Seattle along the north shoreline. I didn't expect that things would get quiet as early as they did, but it was nice that there was little commotion to interefere with sleep as early as 8:00pm. I throughly enjoyed my two stays and wouldn't hesitate to book it again if I am in the area!

review_text: My husband and I stayed here for three nights as part of a long US road trip. It was our first visit to Seattle. The place was wonderful. It's comfortable, clean, and decorated and outfitted with many thoughtful touches. The washer and dryer were especially welcome to us after two weeks on the road. The Murphy bed was easy to set up, and was very comfortable. We slept so well. Other people have mentioned La Rustica restaurant, and we enjoyed it, too. We got take out dinners two nights in a row, and everything was delicious. It's just a block away - an easy walk. We took the water taxi to downtown Seattle every day, and it was very easy. There was plenty of street parking near the water taxi. It was a convenient way to get downtown, and the ride on the harbor was fun, too. I would love to come back when I visit Seattle again.

Very peaceful and quite with quick 1 block walking access to an awesome restaurant (La Rustica-Italian-truly the best Italian food we’ve ever had! The Murphy bed was a chinch to set up every night and stocked well with clean linens. One nice surprise was the washer and dryer, while stated in the description, I did not see a picture and thought it was lacking or an inconvenience to use. But indeed, it in the unit and a great bonus for us! Check in could not have been easier. The location was great, we took walks every night and felt safe to be out after dark. The proximity to water was a wonderful treat! Just across the street from a park to view the sound, we enjoyed it immensely. Great experience. We would highly recommend this stylish Airbnb to anyone visiting the area!

My recent stay at this Airbnb exceeded all expectations. From the moment I stepped inside, I felt like I was walking into a home away from home. The host, Panya, went above and beyond to ensure that my stay was comfortable and enjoyable.
The suite was impeccably clean and tastefully decorated, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.
The location was also fantastic, with easy access to public transportation and plenty of nearby restaurants and attractions.
One of the highlights of my stay was the personalized recommendations provided by Panya. He was more than happy to share his favorite local spots and insider tips, which greatly enhanced my experience in the area.
Overall, I can't recommend this Airbnb highly enough. Whether you're traveling for business or pleasure, this listing is sure to provide a comfortable and memorable stay. Thank you, Panya, for your hospitality and attention to detail. I will definitely be back!

There is plenty of space to park and the neighborhood was quiet and peaceful. Definitely the place where we will stay next time we visit Seattle.

Great little place tucked away from the city. Not too far, about 15-20 mins from pike place and other touristy areas by car. The place had very open spaces and was comfortable overall. The kitchenette worked for us in terms of making breakfast daily - but if you plan to cook quite a bit, it might be tricky. The backyard is beautiful, matches the picture and description well. Ample parking space in the driveway. There’s so much nearby in shoreline to do if you prefer to stay local as well. We loved the mix of the city and what the suburban area had to offer. Only thing is that any movement upstairs can easily be heard in the unit so keep that in mind - didn’t bother us though.
Thanks Panya, we look forward to returning again!

review_text:
This was my second stay at Panya and Shulin’s AirBNB. I really love the location. It is close to where I need to go for work, any grocery I may need, and plenty of restaurants. The thing I really appreciate is how quiet the back yard is even though it’s several blocks from highway 99 (which has tons of great amenities), the tall pine trees and fenced private backyard make it so quiet and peaceful. No road noise at all.
As it was last time, the apartment is private, very clean and very large. There were 3 of us this time and plenty of room for all of us to have private areas/rooms to sleep. There is plenty of natural light as well as other lighting to use after dark.
We continued to enjoy the movie projection room with plenty of apps to choose from and the ability to sign on to apps with your own user data, if wanted. Panya and Shulin are very responsive to any issues or questions. They were super fast to help with sound issue we caused on the sound bar when we pushed a wrong button.

Really lovely space, very clean, with thoughtful details. The kitchen had what we needed, including dishes for four and a very nice coffee maker. The bathroom is pretty with lovely tiles and has convenient hooks and shelves in addition to a full set of towels for the family.
My family loved the movie room. The kids picked out a movie on Disney+ so we were able to enjoy a family movie night. We really appreciated the clear instructions for turning on the projector, sound, and apple TV.
The location was quiet and convenient for where we wanted to be.
It snowed over our last night and Panya shoveled the walk early after sending me a message so we wouldn't be concerned if we saw a person outside. Very thoughtful!

review_text: Panya's place was the perfect spot for our family trip to Shoreline! I stayed here with my husband and 10 month old and we had such a great experience. Instructions were clear and simple, Panya was kind and generous, and the space was exactly as described - clean and comfortable. Having two bedrooms and two living/lounging spaces made for a great stay. The kitchenette set up had everything we needed to prep basic meals at home. The location was top notch - literally across the street from all of the basics (Costco, Starbucks, an acai spot, Panera, and more). Having an off-street parking space and a beautiful patio to relax during the evenings really made this AirBnB stand out. We would love the opportunity to stay here again!

name: Heather
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I had a wonderful stay at Panya’s place. It is well located for everywhere I needed to go in Shoreline and North Seattle for work. The location is close to the freeway and easy to access. Check in was a breeze and Panya was very quick to answer with any questions I had prior to my stay. The space is clean, spacious and perfect for work or play. My guest and I really enjoyed the projector screen movie room which had access to plenty of streaming platforms and I had no problem signing on to my own account for my own saved shows and movies. The sound system is wonderful. Seriously like being in a movie theater. There are printed out step-by-step instructions on how to work the entertainment system. The kitchenette was perfect for me to make coffee and store refrigerated stuff I brought with me. I ate out most evening meals and there are so many good restaurants in Shoreline (Scott’s can’t be beat for a steakhouse), Richmond Beach, and Montlake Terrace. There are multiple different grocery stores close by including a Costco.
I was thankful to have a dedicated work space to finish my paperwork each day. There is a laundry room, although I didn’t use it. The bathroom was spacious and had a nice tub/shower combo. The bedrooms had wall heaters that warmed up the rooms very fast. The backyard is clean and large and fully fenced in so nice if you have a dog. There are two friendly kitties wandering around and cute chickens in front. The neighborhood is quite and has walking trails that are easily accessed as is Richmond Beach. I think the apartment is very well priced for the size and amenities. I will absolutely stay again if it is available when I come over for work or play in the future. Thank you!

Lovely spot in a nice neighborhood! We enjoyed our stay with our dog for two weeks here. Space is large enough, the theater room is very fun to have for evenings in. Kitchen is pretty limited but no surprises there. One can definitely make do with the mini fridge, microwave, toaster oven, and dual burner.
Host was accommodating and quick to respond, I think we only ran into her once in person. The neighbors are also very friendly, we enjoyed walking our dog around. We also LOVED having the hot pot and kbbq place at the end of the street, and the Cuban sandwich shop make for easy eating out in walking distance.
Location is about 25 min from downtown, so a bit out of the way if you’re looking to spend lots of time in Seattle, but the easy access to 99 and I5 make all travel pretty simple.
